page.title: 06Middlesex Polytechnic
page.content: This is one of the largest Polytechnics in the country, with 6,500 full-time & 2000 part-time students. The Polytechnic has various sites in North London. The Ponders End site is on the Hertford Rd., & was formerly a large house. Swan (the inventor of the light bulb) lived opposite the present site & invented the light bulb in the basement of the old house. Many different courses are run, over 130 at degree & postgraduate level. Social Sciences & some Civil Engineering courses are based at Ponders End. There are full-time, part-time & block release courses. The Swan Annexe is to be closed shortly, through lack of money, and its work will be incorporated in the other main buildings in Ponders End.
